metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

properties.description: Silverfort data connector with template version 3.0.0

connectorUiConfig.title: Silverfort Admin Console
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
The [Silverfort](https://silverfort.com) ITDR Admin Console connector solution allows ingestion of Silverfort events and logging into Microsoft Sentinel.
 Silverfort provides syslog based events and logging using Common Event Format (CEF). By forwarding your Silverfort ITDR Admin Console CEF data into Microsoft Sentinel, you can take advantage of Sentinels's search & correlation, alerting, and threat intelligence enrichment on Silverfort data. 
 Please contact Silverfort or consult the Silverfort documentation for more information.

graphQueries.baseQuery:
CommonSecurityLog
| where DeviceVendor == "Silverfort"
| where DeviceProduct == "Admin Console"

sampleQueries.description: Get all User Brute Force incidents
sampleQueries.query:
CommonSecurityLog 
  | where DeviceVendor has 'Silverfort'
  | where DeviceProduct has 'Admin Console'
  | where DeviceEventClassID == "NewIncident"
  | where Message has "UserBruteForce"

dataTypes.name: CommonSecurityLog (DATATYPE_NAME)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CommonSecurityLog
| where DeviceVendor == "Silverfort"
| where DeviceProduct == "Admin Console"
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

value:
CommonSecurityLog
| where DeviceVendor == "Silverfort"
| where DeviceProduct == "Admin Console"
| summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
| project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description:
Install and configure the Linux agent to collect your Common Event Format (CEF) Syslog messages and forward them to Microsoft Sentinel.

> Notice that the data from all regions will be stored in the selected workspace

innerSteps.title: 1.1 Select or create a Linux machine
innerSteps.description: Select or create a Linux machine that Microsoft Sentinel will use as the proxy between your security solution and Microsoft Sentinel this machine can be on your on-prem environment, Azure or other clouds.

innerSteps.title: 1.2 Install the CEF collector on the Linux machine
innerSteps.description:
Install the Microsoft Monitoring Agent on your Linux machine and configure the machine to listen on the necessary port and forward messages to your Microsoft Sentinel workspace. The CEF collector collects CEF messages on port 514 TCP.

> 1. Make sure that you have Python on your machine using the following command: python -version.

> 2. You must have elevated permissions (sudo) on your machine.

parameters.label: Run the following command to install and apply the CEF collector:

instructionSteps.title: 1. Linux Syslog agent configuration

instructionSteps.description: Set your security solution to send Syslog messages in CEF format to the proxy machine. Make sure you to send the logs to port 514 TCP on the machine's IP address.
instructionSteps.title: 2. Forward Common Event Format (CEF) logs to Syslog agent

instructionSteps.description:
Follow the instructions to validate your connectivity:

Open Log Analytics to check if the logs are received using the CommonSecurityLog schema.

>It may take about 20 minutes until the connection streams data to your workspace.

If the logs are not received, run the following connectivity validation script:

> 1. Make sure that you have Python on your machine using the following command: python -version

>2. You must have elevated permissions (sudo) on your machine

parameters.label: Run the following command to validate your connectivity:

instructionSteps.title: 3. Validate connection

instructionSteps.description:
Make sure to configure the machine's security according to your organization's security policy


[Learn more >](https://aka.ms/SecureCEF)
instructionSteps.title: 4. Secure your machine

metadata.description:
The [Silverfort](https://silverfort.com) ITDR Admin Console connector solution allows ingestion of Silverfort events and logging into Microsoft Sentinel.
 Silverfort provides syslog based events and logging using Common Event Format (CEF). By forwarding your Silverfort ITDR Admin Console CEF data into Microsoft Sentinel, you can take advantage of Sentinels's search & correlation, alerting, and threat intelligence enrichment on Silverfort data. 
 Please contact Silverfort or consult the Silverfort documentation for more information.

properties.description:
@{workbookKey=SilverfortWorkbook; logoFileName=silverfort-logo.svg; description=The [Silverfort](https://silverfort.com) ITDR Admin Console connector solution allows ingestion of Silverfort events and logging into Microsoft Sentinel.
 Silverfort provides syslog based events and logging using Common Event Format (CEF). By forwarding your Silverfort ITDR Admin Console CEF data into Microsoft Sentinel, you can take advantage of Sentinels's search & correlation, alerting, and threat intelligence enrichment on Silverfort data. 
 Please contact Silverfort or consult the Silverfort documentation for more information.; dataTypesDependencies=System.Object[]; dataConnectorsDependencies=System.Object[]; previewImagesFileNames=System.Object[]; version=1.0.0; title=Silverfort Admin Console; templateRelativePath=SilverfortWorkbook.json; subtitle=; provider=Silverfort}.description
Certifried_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
An Active Directory domain privilege escalation vulnerability that enables a privileged user to access the Domain Controller by abusing Active Directory Certificate Service
properties.query:
CommonSecurityLog 
| where DeviceVendor has 'Silverfort'
| where DeviceProduct has 'Admin Console'
| where DeviceEventClassID == "NewIncident"
| where Message has "Certifried"
| extend UserName = parse_json(replace('^""|""$', '', Message))['userName']

properties.description: Log4Shell_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected systems by exploiting a flaw in the way Log4j handles log messages containing specially crafted strings
properties.query:
CommonSecurityLog 
| where DeviceVendor has 'Silverfort'
| where DeviceProduct has 'Admin Console'
| where DeviceEventClassID == "NewIncident"
| where Message has "Log4Shell"
| extend UserName = parse_json(replace('^""|""$', '', Message))['userName']

properties.description: NoPac_Breach_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
The NoPac vulnerability involves privilege escalation, allowing attackers to gain unauthorized access and potentially take control of an entire Active Directory domain
properties.query:
CommonSecurityLog 
| where DeviceVendor has 'Silverfort'
| where DeviceProduct has 'Admin Console'
| where DeviceEventClassID == "NewIncident"
| where Message has "NoPacBreach"
| extend UserName = parse_json(replace('^""|""$', '', Message))['userName']

properties.description: User_Brute_Force_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
A security weakness that allows attackers to gain unauthorized access to user accounts by systematically guessing the username and password combinations.
properties.query:
CommonSecurityLog 
| where DeviceVendor has 'Silverfort'
| where DeviceProduct has 'Admin Console'
| where DeviceEventClassID == "NewIncident"
| where Message has "UserBruteForce"
| extend UserName = parse_json(replace('^""|""$', '', Message))['userName']

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

Review the solution Release Notes

There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The Silverfort ITDR Admin Console connector solution allows ingestion of Silverfort events and logging into Microsoft Sentinel. Silverfort provides syslog based events and logging using Common Event Format (CEF). By forwarding your Silverfort ITDR Admin Console CEF data into Microsoft Sentinel, you can take advantage of Sentinels's search & correlation, alerting, and threat intelligence enrichment on Silverfort data. Please contact Silverfort or consult the Silverfort documentation for more information.

Data Connectors: 1, Workbooks: 1, Analytic Rules: 4

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
